para.p:
Let
q
and
l
be positive integers. Define

Math.text: c _ q * l = (sum _ ((gcd@(h, q) = 1) ^ (1 less= j less= q)))@(e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * h * l) / q)) = (sum _ ((gcd@(h, q) = 1) ^ (1 less= h less= q)))@(e ^ ((2 * pi * i * h * l) / q)) = (sum _ ((gcd@(h, q) = 1) ^ (1 less= h less= q)))@(cosine@((2 * pi * h * l) / q))

para.p:
⁢
c q
( l )
is called Ramanujan’s sum.

section.title:
2Fourier transform on
/ Z q
and the principal Dirichlet character modulo
q

para.p:
For
: F
→
/ Z q
C
, the Fourier transform
:
^ F
→
/ Z q
C
of
F
is defined by

Math.text: formulae@(widehat@(F) * k = (1 / q) * (sum _ (j element-of Z / q))@(F * j * e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * j * k) / q)), k element-of Z / q)

para.p:
Define
: χ
→
/ Z q
C
by
=
⁢ χ
( j )
1
if
=
gcd
( j , q )
1
and
=
⁢ χ
( j )
0
if
>
gcd
( j , q )
1
.
χ
is called the principal Dirichlet character modulo
q
. The Fourier transform of
χ
is

Math.text: widehat@(chi) * k = (1 / q) * (sum _ (j element-of Z / q))@(chi * j * e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * j * k) / q)) = (1 / q) * (sum _ ((gcd@(j, q) = 1) ^ (1 less= j less= q)))@(e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * j * k) / q))

para.p:
Therefore we can write Ramanujan’s sum
⁢
c q
( l )
as
=
⁢
c q
( l )
⁢
⋅ q
^ χ
( l )
, thus
=
c q
⋅ q
^ χ
.

The above gives us an expression for
⁢
c q
( l )
as a multiple of the Fourier transform of the principal Dirichlet character modulo
q
.
:
c q
→
/ Z q
C
, and we can write the Fourier transform of
c q
as

Math.text: widehat@(c _ q) * k = (1 / q) * (sum _ (j element-of Z / q))@(c _ q * j * e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * j * k) / q)) = (sum _ (j element-of Z / q))@(widehat@(chi) * j * e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * j * k) / q))
widehat@(c _ q) * k
(1 / q) * (sum _ (j element-of Z / q))@(c _ q * j * e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * j * k) / q))
(sum _ (j element-of Z / q))@(widehat@(chi) * j * e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * j * k) / q))

para.p:
Here I am following Titchmarsh in §1.5 of his The theory of the Riemann zeta-function, second ed. Let
μ
be the Möbius function. The Möbius inversion formula states that if

Math.text: g * q = (sum _ (conditional@(d, q)))@(f * d)

para.p: then

Math.text: f * q = (sum _ (conditional@(d, q)))@(mu * (q / d) * g * d)

para.p:
(
∑
| d q
is a sum over the positive divisors of
q
.)
Define

Math.text: eta _ q * k = (sum _ (j element-of Z / q))@(e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * j * k) / q))

para.p: We have (this is not supposed to be obvious)

Math.text: eta _ q * k = (sum _ (conditional@(d, q)))@(c _ d * k)

para.p: Therefore by the Möbius inversion formula we have

Math.text: c _ q * k = (sum _ (conditional@(d, q)))@(mu * (q / d) * eta _ d * k)

para.p:
(Hence
|
⁢
c q
( k )
|
≤
∑
| d k
d
=
⁢
σ 1
( k )
, where
=
⁢
σ a
( k )
∑
| d k
d a
.)

If
| q k
then
=
⁢
η q
( k )
q
, and if
|̸ q k
then
=
⁢
η q
( k )
0
. (To show the second statement: multiply the sum by
e
-
/
⁢ 2 π i k
q
, and check that this product is equal to the original sum. Since we multplied the sum by a number that is not
1
, the sum must be equal to
0
.) Thus we can express the Möbius function using Ramanujan’s sum as
=
⁢ μ
( q )
⁢
c q
( 1 )
.

Because
=
⁢
η d
( k )
d
if
| k d
and
=
⁢
η d
( k )
0
if
|̸ k d
, we have

Math.text: c _ q * k = (sum _ [d|q,d|k])@(mu * (q / d) * d) = (sum _ (d * r = list@(q, conditional@(d, k))))@(mu * r * d)

para.p: So

Math.text: (c _ q * k) / q ^ s = (sum _ (d * r = list@(q, conditional@(d, k))))@((1 / q ^ s) * mu * r * d) = (sum _ (d * r = list@(q, conditional@(d, k))))@((1 / (d ^ s * r ^ s)) * mu * r * d) = (sum _ (d * r = list@(q, conditional@(d, k))))@((1 / r ^ s) * mu * r * d ^ (1 - s))

para.p: Therefore

Math.text: ((sum _ (q = 1)) ^ infinity)@((c _ q * k) / q ^ s) = ((sum _ (q = 1)) ^ infinity)@((sum _ (d * r = list@(q, conditional@(d, k))))@((1 / r ^ s) * mu * r * d ^ (1 - s))) = ((sum _ (r = 1)) ^ infinity)@((sum _ (conditional@(d, k)))@((1 / r ^ s) * mu * r * d ^ (1 - s))) = ((sum _ (r = 1)) ^ infinity)@((1 / r ^ s) * mu * r * (sum _ (conditional@(d, k)))@(d ^ (1 - s)))

para.p: Then

Math.text: ((sum _ (q = 1)) ^ infinity)@((c _ q * k) / q ^ s) = sigma _ (1 - s) * k * ((sum _ (r = 1)) ^ infinity)@((1 / r ^ s) * mu * r) = sigma _ (1 - s) * k * (1 / (zeta * s))

para.p: here we used that

Math.text: 1 / (zeta * s) = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@((mu * n) / n ^ s)

para.p:
On the other hand, if rather than sum over
q
we sum over
k
, then we obtain

Math.text: ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@((c _ q * k) / k ^ s) = ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@((1 / k ^ s) * (sum _ [d|q,d|k])@(mu * (q / d) * d)) = (sum _ (conditional@(d, q)))@(((sum _ (m = 1)) ^ infinity)@(((1 / (m * d) ^ s) cdot mu) * (q / d) * d)) = (sum _ (conditional@(d, q)))@(((sum _ (m = 1)) ^ infinity)@(((1 / m ^ s) cdot (1 / d ^ s) cdot mu) * (q / d) * d)) = ((sum _ (m = 1)) ^ infinity)@((1 / m ^ s) * (sum _ (conditional@(d, q)))@((1 / d ^ s) * mu * (q / d) * d)) = (zeta * s) cdot (sum _ (conditional@(d, q)))@(mu * (q / d) * d ^ (1 - s))
((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@((c _ q * k) / k ^ s)
((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ infinity)@((1 / k ^ s) * (sum _ [d|q,d|k])@(mu * (q / d) * d))
(sum _ (conditional@(d, q)))@(((sum _ (m = 1)) ^ infinity)@(((1 / (m * d) ^ s) cdot mu) * (q / d) * d))
(sum _ (conditional@(d, q)))@(((sum _ (m = 1)) ^ infinity)@(((1 / m ^ s) cdot (1 / d ^ s) cdot mu) * (q / d) * d))
((sum _ (m = 1)) ^ infinity)@((1 / m ^ s) * (sum _ (conditional@(d, q)))@((1 / d ^ s) * mu * (q / d) * d))
(zeta * s) cdot (sum _ (conditional@(d, q)))@(mu * (q / d) * d ^ (1 - s))
